page.title: 08TREGONNING HILL (3)
page.content: The quarrying of china clay continued until about 1920 with the clay being exported from Porthleven by sea. Around 1920 china clay was found near St. Austell and this saw the end of china clay quarrying on Tregonning Hill.The firm working the hill reverted to brick production and the kiln used to fire the bricks can still be seen on the side of the hill. The latest period of human activity on Tregonning Hill has seen the reclaiming of moorland on the lower slopes for agricultural use .The spoil heaps have been covered with top soil and the old mine shafts filled in.
